content.description: Thin face climbing to two difficult roofs to a dirty face. More traffic would serve this route well.
content.location: The fourth route with bolts past "Entropy" (the prominent arete). Look for the black streak and start on the ledge.

climbs.name: Gnarly to the Max
climbs.fa: J.D. McCay, Jim Bodenhamer, Mike Sanders, 1984

content.description: Begin in a shallow dihedral and climb up using a left-trending crack until you reach the chimney. The rock between the start and chimney is very loose so be careful. Blast through the chimney and move right to the anchors.
content.protection: Shares bolt anchors with Queen for a Day
content.location: This is the first route after passing the Centerfold Wall. The route begins in a shallow dihedral with a small tree in the way.

content.description: An old-school classic that keeps your attention the entire way. Delicate footwork will get you to the 4th bolt, where easier terrain carries you to a run-out 5th bolt. The anchors are protected by a tricky slab.
content.location: Starts at the base of a fallen pine tree.

content.description: A striking arete, one of AR's finest.  Sustained movement leads to the anchors under the roof.
content.location: 2-3 minute hike East past Centerfold.  This arete stands out and would be hard to miss.

content.description: This area contains about 20 routes mostly consisting of low-quality trad with a handful of decent sport.
